author: Brad Hanson
title: Pleasant Valley crushes Dubuque Hempstead, 49-7
text:
Pleasant Valley crushes Dubuque Hempstead, 49-7 - KWWL - Eastern Iowa Breaking News, Weather, Closings Member Center: Pleasant Valley crushes Dubuque Hempstead, 49-7 Posted: Friday Night Heroes Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> More >> DUBUQUE (KWWL) - 
It was a chilly night in Dubuque, but that didn't seem to bother the red hot Pleasant Valley Spartans. 
They come into this week on a three game winning streak, and didn't show any signs of slowing down. 
Spartans running back C.J. Carter plays a big role in that, picking up the early 55-yard gain down the sideline. 
That would set up quarterback Terry Saul with a touchdown run right up the middle to put the Spartans up 7-0. 
Hempstead's Marshon Crowder coughs up the ball on the next possession, and Pleasant Valley recovers. 
Two snaps later, Arthur Braden breaks off a 45-yard touchdown run to put the Spartans up 14-0 early. 
In the 2nd quarter, Hempstead finally answers. Quarterback Cole Muehring gets the pass to Crowder, who does the rest. He hurdles one man, makes another man miss, then puts his shoulder down to get into the endzone and pull the game within 7. 
After being shut out in the 2nd quarter, the Spartans bust this game wide open in the second half. Hempstead turns the ball over three times and Pleasant Valley scores 35 points to put this one to bed. 
Pleasant Valley 49, Dubuque Hempstead 7.
